channel.title: CVE Feed for vim -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for vim -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-1616|2024-08-03T00:10:03.606Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: Use after free in append_command in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4895. This vulnerability is capable of crashing software, Bypass Protection Mechanism, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution

item.title: CVE-2022-1620|2024-08-03T00:10:03.680Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4901. NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input.

item.title: CVE-2022-1629|2024-08-03T00:10:03.941Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: Buffer Over-read in function find_next_quote in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4925. This vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution

item.title: CVE-2022-1720|2024-08-03T00:10:03.797Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: Buffer Over-read in function grab_file_name in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4956. This vulnerability is capable of crashing the software, memory modification, and possible remote execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-1621|2024-08-03T00:10:03.947Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: Heap buffer overflow in vim_strncpy find_word in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4919. This vulnerability is capable of crashing software, Bypass Protection Mechanism, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution

item.title: CVE-2022-1674|2024-08-03T00:10:03.912Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2733 in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4938. NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2733 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input.

item.title: CVE-2022-1619|2024-08-03T00:10:03.595Z -- vim -- vim%2Fvim
item.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in function cmdline_erase_chars in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4899. This vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software, modify memory, and possible remote execution

item.title: CVE-2024-41957|2024-08-02T15:32:16.672Z -- vim -- vim
item.description: Vim is an open source command line text editor. Vim < v9.1.0647 has double free in src/alloc.c:616. When closing a window, the corresponding tagstack data will be cleared and freed. However a bit later, the quickfix list belonging to that window will also be cleared and if that quickfix list points to the same tagstack data, Vim will try to free it again, resulting in a double-free/use-after-free access exception. Impact is low since the user must intentionally execute vim with several non-default flags, but it may cause a crash of Vim. The issue has been fixed as of Vim patch v9.1.0647

item.title: CVE-2024-41965|2024-08-01T21:44:09.056Z -- vim -- vim
item.description: Vim is an open source command line text editor. double-free in dialog_changed() in Vim < v9.1.0648. When abandoning a buffer, Vim may ask the user what to do with the modified buffer. If the user wants the changed buffer to be saved, Vim may create a new Untitled file, if the buffer did not have a name yet. However, when setting the buffer name to Unnamed, Vim will falsely free a pointer twice, leading to a double-free and possibly later to a heap-use-after-free, which can lead to a crash. The issue has been fixed as of Vim patch v9.1.0648.

item.title: CVE-2024-41957|2024-08-01T21:41:42.921Z -- vim -- vim
item.description: Vim is an open source command line text editor. Vim < v9.1.0647 has double free in src/alloc.c:616. When closing a window, the corresponding tagstack data will be cleared and freed. However a bit later, the quickfix list belonging to that window will also be cleared and if that quickfix list points to the same tagstack data, Vim will try to free it again, resulting in a double-free/use-after-free access exception. Impact is low since the user must intentionally execute vim with several non-default flags, but it may cause a crash of Vim. The issue has been fixed as of Vim patch v9.1.0647
